Keywords: Excalibur , Generation X , Mystical , X-Men
Real Name: Jubilation Lee
Special Powers
RALLY (5): Opposing Attack Rolls. FREE: Remove Jubilee's RALLY die. If you do, she can use Probability Control until your next turn.
DISORIENTING BLAST: Incapacitate. When she uses it to give action tokens, after resolutions hit characters can't use team abilities until your next turn.
Trade Jubilee Want Jubilee

Comments
June 15, 2022
SkullAngel
On a Generation X theme team she gives Synch things to copy and that turning off team Abilities is pretty great with all the Mystic and Power Cosmic being able to pile on a character that doesn’t have Mystic for the turn or being able to outwit after they can’t use PC team ability now you could argue that Generation X has Banshee for that especially with the Legacy card being revealed. But I wouldn’t knock this piece at the 35 point dial that power is pretty great. And if we are going for comic accurate theme team the 75pt dial does offer Gen X options
January 18, 2022
reanimationguy
Of all the things to complain about, Jubilee not having reducers doesn’t really make sense. She never does (unless she’s a vampire or flying around on Shogo’s dragon form), nor should she. As far as Jubilee being worth 75 points or not, I’d say compare her to recent figs in her weight class like the Daredevil from this set or rare Hawkeye from CAAV. People seem to like both of those pieces, so I don’t see why she gets sidelined so hard. She has one more click of health than each of them, brings Defend and Leadership as support, and can shut down TAs. I don’t see a meta contender here, but I do see a fig that’s worth 75 points in a casual environment.
January 3, 2022
The Singularity
Yeah... I'm just not going to field a figure with naked defense. I'd get so frustrated it someone with poison just followed me around the board until I died...
